segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 21
segments.en: Linked Discourses 21

segments.pli: 1. Bhikkhuvagga
segments.en: 1. Monks

segments.pli: 1. Kolitasutta
segments.en: 1. With Kolita

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “āvuso bhikkhave”ti.
segments.en: “Reverends, mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend,” they replied.

segments.pli: Āyasmā mahāmoggallāno etadavoca:
segments.en: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said this:

segments.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, āvuso, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
segments.en: “Just now, reverends, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind:

segments.pli: ‘ariyo tuṇhībhāvo, ariyo tuṇhībhāvoti vuccati.
segments.en: ‘They speak of this thing called “noble silence”.

segments.pli: Katamo nu kho ariyo tuṇhībhāvo’ti?
segments.en: What then is this noble silence?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ āvuso, etadahosi:
segments.en: It occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘idha bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: ‘As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati ariyo tuṇhībhāvo’ti.
segments.en: This is called noble silence.’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, āvuso, vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihariṃ.
segments.en: And so, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected were stilled, I was entering and remaining in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, āvuso, iminā vihārena viharato vitakkasahagatā saññā manasikārā samudācaranti.
segments.en: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by placing the mind beset me.

segments.pli: Atha kho maṃ, āvuso, bhagavā iddhiyā upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,

segments.pli: ‘moggallāna moggallāna, mā, brāhmaṇa, ariyaṃ tuṇhībhāvaṃ pamādo, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ ekodibhāvaṃ karohi, ariye tuṇhībhāve cittaṃ samādahā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Moggallāna, Moggallāna! Don’t neglect noble silence, brahmin! Settle your mind in noble silence; unify your mind and bring it to immersion in noble silence.’

segments.pli: So khvāhaṃ, āvuso, aparena samayena vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharāmi.
segments.en: And so, after some time, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected were stilled, I entered and remained in the second absorption …

segments.pli: Yañhi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
segments.en: So if anyone should be rightly called

segments.pli: ‘satthārā anuggahito sāvako mahābhiññataṃ patto’ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
segments.en: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”

segments.pli: ‘satthārā anuggahito sāvako mahābhiññataṃ patto’”ti.
Paṭhamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Moggallāna reflects that second absorption is the true noble silence, and the Buddha encourages him to develop it.
